summary.p:
The palm-leaf bundle, a composite manuscript, entitled Viratam Iraṇṭu on its additional title page, contains:
The Rāmatēvar Pūcāviti, "Rules for worship by Rāmatēvar", which appears to be a manual for worship by Rāmatēvar, in 200 stanzas (Indien 4a). The text is complete.
The Nāṟkaraṇavupatēcam, "Teaching on the four karaṇams", which appears to be a lesson on the four karaṇams, that is, the four organs of perceptions (Indien 4b). The text is complete.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (January 2020).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

origin.origDate: Indien 4a dated to the year carvacittu of the Jovian cycle, that is, CE 1827-1828, 1767-1768, 1707-1708, etc. See colophon (f45r4). Composite manuscript dated to circa 1840 by Vinson (1866-1867, 1867, 1867-1868) and to 1840 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequeathed in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. — See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
